stack the blue block on top of the yellow block

Is this solution correct?

Our goal is to have the orange block on top of the red block.

From the plan, we can see that the goal is not achievable with the given plan. The plan tries to stack the red block on top of the blue block, which is not necessary for achieving the goal.

Here's a new plan to achieve the goal:

[PLAN]
unstack the blue block from on top of the red block
put down the blue block
unstack the red block from on top of the orange block
put down the red block
pick up the orange block
stack the orange block on top of the red block
[PLAN END]

This plan achieves the goal by:

1. Removing the blue block from on top of the red block
2. Removing the red block from on top of the orange block
3. Picking up the orange block
4. Placing the orange block on top of the red block

The resulting state will have the orange block on top of the red block, achieving the goal.

(put-down blue)
(unstack red orange)
(put-down red)
(pick-up orange)
(stack orange red)
